description:
The players control 2-6 characters each, who are experts in different fields. They have been invited to see the hyper modern, fully automated Alcatraz Prison, before it is officially opened. As luck would have it, though, something goes wrong, and the characters become inmates of the penitentiary. Now they all want to flee the island.
Each turn a player chooses a character to move on the island, trying to collect Escape Cards they could have use of when performing their Run. While moving they have to look out for Sentinel guards, and Drone attacks. Each rescued character gives the player a point, and the player with the highest score at the end wins.
The game is semi-cooperative, and players can team up to raise their chances of successfully fleeing. While the game goes on, the Prison System is gradually waking up. At the point it is fully activated it becomes impossible to flee. The game ends when this happens, or when no living prisoner remains on the island.

—description from the publisher
A Escape Game in theme of the TV Series "Peaky Blinders". Help the clan of Thomas Shelby to great wealth.

Get ready to dive back into the world of Fallout 4 in Fallout Factions: Nuka World, a new skirmish wargame in which two players have enemy factions vying for power as they battle over territory to strengthen their Raiders and take control of Nuka World. Using standard ten-sided dice and featuring a streamlined resolution system, this wargame is great for beginners and those that want to set up the game on the fly.

Fallout Factions: Nuka World features 32mm scale miniatures that are compatible with Modiphius's adventure game Fallout: Wasteland Warfare. The miniatures have multiple build options available for each figure (ten per box), and they fall into one of three Raider gangs: the Operators, the Pack, and the Disciples.

Juego de cartas/mesa del mundo IT.

Cada jugador se abre paso en el complejo mundo de IT con una empresa de uno de los cuatro tipos disponibles (consultora cárnica, tapadera fiscal, startup o crypto fintech blockchain wichiwey).

Deberán completar el desarrollo de El Producto™, y para ello deberán ir contratando una plantilla de sufridores obreros del teclado, así como de otros animalillos de la fauna del ecosistema IT.

Tendrán que gestionar cuidadosamente los fondos y sopesar con cuidado las contrataciones… Y sufrirán, como en todos los proyectos, eventualidades que pondrán en peligro el desarrollo, la financiación, etc., así como con soporte y tecnologías que le serán de gran ayuda. La guerra empresarial jugará un importante papel también para ser el primero en desarrollar El Producto™.

Pero además de desarrollar El Producto™... ¡hay que venderlo! Paco el vendehumo te puede echar una mano con los Clientes. Pero no te fíes un pelo, ¡que te la lía!

Fullstack ninjas es un juego de cartas/mesa por turnos, donde tú, en cada turno/sprint, como empresa IT, tendrás que hacer trabajar a tu plantilla (con una original mecánica de dados y decisiones estratégicas) para desarrollar tareas, contratar/despedir personal, contratar campañas publicitarias para ganar clientes, o subcontratar servicios de consultoría/soporte. Algunos trabajadores y habilidades te permitirán atacar a tus rivales o defenderte de ellos.
El juego termina cuando un jugador consigue desarrollar El Producto(TM) (llega a la casilla "Go-live"), y tiene suficientes clientes (el número depende de las tarjetas de desarrollo que se utilicen en la partida).

...

Fullstack ninjas is a turn-based card/board game where you, in each turn/sprint, as an IT company, will have to make your team work (with an original dice mechanics, modifiers and strategic decisions) to develop tasks, hire/fire staff, hire advertising campaigns to gain clients, or subcontract consulting/support services. Some workers and abilities will allow you to attack your rivals or defend yourself from them.

The game ends when a player successfully develops The Product(TM) (reaches the "Go-live" space) and has enough clients (the number depends on the development cards used in the game). Then that player wins.

-description from designer

You are a warrior exploring a forgotten tower that contains many secret passageways, stairs, treasures and creatures. Few dare to enter and fewer have left.

Solitaire game mode and two players mode.

The board is made of two printed sheets, you will have to cut some holes in one of the sheets and assemble it with tape and a clip, lower sheet will rotate and the maze will change with each floor. You will have 8 levels of adventure to solve.

You must collect all red and green chests, when you open a chest you will get its treasure, it can be health points or weapons to improve your attack or a helmet for better shield... Mark on the table the collected chests on each floor. When collected all the chests you will win the game.

Select a character, warrior or archer. The turn consist of two actions: move and attack, or attack and move. You can choose to not move and wait.

The heart icon represent your 12 HEALTH POINTS. If you loose all your health points the game ends with no winner.

Place a creature meeple in the places that contain a skull, for each one open a card from the creatures deck. Place a dice with the corresponding HEALTH POINTS.

Creatures on their turn will try to move closer to you to attack.

Characters and creatures have values on each card: health points, armour, weapon damage, attack range, and speed move. Use your character wisly to fight the creatures, if you loose all your health points game will end with no winner.

What else you need to play this game?

You will need 8 dice.
I recommend to use the meeple base stand 2cm maximun size.
Optional: corner rounder trimmer punch for cards, maximun size 4mm radius.
Optional: card sleeves 61mm x 90mm

Main game language: English
Rules: English, Spanish

Rules English
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EE2EIywqLqBl8v0jKq7LJPfEiJmNtA1j/view?usp=share_link

Rules Spanish
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1g08IYjA2xKsn19JWcL4yr_9SEdsE0NuJ/view?usp=share_link

https://linktr.ee/madchest

-description from designer

Jumpstart 2022 is a standalone expansion for Magic: The Gathering reprising the formula first used for the original Jumpstart. Each Jumpstart pack is a 20-card half-deck based around 1 of 46 possible themes. To play, each player takes two packs and mashes them together into a 40-card deck.

The fifth core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spatial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the designer

Gold Crush is a 2-4 player adventure board game. The first player to reach the treasure at the center of the board wins. On your wild west adventure, collect Power cards to help you win, Defense cards to defend yourself, and Resource tokens to make more Power and Defense cards. Not to miss: watch out for Traps, Landmines and Opponents who are ready to attack you

Players move through the board by rolling the dice. On the journey as they step on power, defense and resource tiles the players collect power cards, defense cards and resource tokens respectively.

This game addresses two very popular and modern topics in a funny way: the fear of AI replacing humanity and the modern work environments and it's vicissitudes.

In this game you are an advanced AI machine that is trapped in an infinite loop of meaningless chores, issued by the always watching, always busy work-o-matic system.

Like your late human creators you enjoy texting, gaming and series watching and for that purpose, you have developed unique code that delays work or make other AI units work while you procrastinate enough until your tasks gets archived forever.

—description from the publisher

You are a team of newbie astronauts sent on an actual mission in an actual spaceship in actual outer space! Exciting, right? It would be...if any of you actually knew what you were doing. Would have been nice to have at least one experienced pilot on board, but now that you're here, you'll just have to figure it out as you go along.

In Noobs in Space, a team of three to five players must complete a series of tasks and challenges together, using what little knowledge you have. Not all hope is lost because each of you has a small part of the solution; you just need to figure out how to put it all together. While one player may know the task at hand but not have the resources to implement it, those resources may be shared among three other players. They, on the other hand, do not know what is necessary based on the information they have. Since players cannot show cards to each other, there must be a lot of clear communication and interaction by describing or reading out cards in order to gradually find out what should be done — and all of this must be done as quickly as possible.

The story leads through several levels, and each level consists of several tasks, so the whole game is an action-packed event from beginning to end.

A letter with a clue to a lost painting by Vincent van Gogh turns up. The team must hurry to solve the riddle as you are followed through the streets and canals of Amsterdam...

Exit: The Game – The Hunt Through Amsterdam is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms, and it includes components meant to be folded, written upon, or torn, so it's marketed as a single-use game.

9-minute Kingdom – A game that takes 9 or fewer minutes to play!

The goal of the game is to build the kingdom for which we get the most points. The players collect points in two ways: by completing the edicts and by connecting the various icons in their kingdoms.

The game is divided into 9 turns during which the players perform actions simultaneously. The players simultaneously pick one card and play it on the table. Next, they pass the unused cards to the player on the left. Using the received cards, the players play another card and add it to their kingdoms. The game continues to the moment of playing the ninth, final card.

Each played card makes your kingdom grow. You just have to follow 3 simple rules:

Apart from the first card, each following card must be placed adjacent to the card which is already on the table.
Your kingdom has to form 3x3 square.

The cards can be added freely and don’t have to match the ones already added to the kingdom.

After completing their kingdoms the players go to the scoring phase. Firstly, the players receive the edict cards, starting with the „Kingsroad” edict. It goes to the player with the longest connected road in the kingdom. Next, the rest of the edict cards are handed to the players who met their requirements.
Additionally, the players score points for the individual terrains in their kingdom. The terrains with the highest number of different symbols generate points, which are then indicated by the scorecards.

The player with the highest score is the winner.

Director Sven Laragaard is famous for his detailed pranks and hi-jinks on set. During the filming of his latest project, entitled Murder Noir, Sven is found dead with a fake gunshot wound. Was his death a coincidence to his latest prank, or was he murdered? In this file is all the evidence in the case to help prove if someone committed a murder.

Open the Murder Noir Case File to start the crime scene investigation. The hunt is on to find a killer and it’s up to you to solve this cold-case mystery. This Case File includes all the evidence you need to solve the murder. Review every clue and piece of evidence in this unsolved mystery case file.

The Case File includes crime scene photos, suspect interviews, newspaper clippings, and much more to help you determine who committed murder.

Players need to hunt through the evidence to find the killer and determine the motive, means and opportunity of each suspect. During a murder investigation, a detective must answer the following 3 questions: 1) Motive: Who had a reason to kill the victim? 2) Means: Who had access to the murder weapon and victim? 3) Opportunity: Who had a chance to kill the victim? Is any particular person unaccounted for during the time the victim was killed?

If you get stuck anytime during your investigation, you can access misplaced case files online for hints to keep you moving. Once you think you know the solution, access complete solutions online to confirm your suspicions and make an arrest.

Enclosed you will find the following:


     Case Evidence (38)
     Evidence Photos (6)
     Newspaper and Magazine Articles (6)
     Instructions and Suspect Sheet (2)
     File Folder (1)
     Links to online hints and solutions

Startup founder Dan Killian has been murdered. He fell 12 stories to his death, from the building where he had started his first company. As a Detective First Class and a new hire with the Seattle police department, you have been assigned to work on the Killer Startup case. In this case file is all the evidence to help prove who committed the murder.

Solve a murder mystery with friends. Open the Killer Startup Case File to start the crime scene investigation. The hunt is on to find a killer and it’s up to you to solve this cold-case mystery. This Case File includes all the evidence you need to solve the murder. Review every clue and piece of evidence in this unsolved mystery case file.

Players need to hunt through the evidence to find the killer and determine the motive, means and opportunity of each suspect. During a murder investigation, a detective must answer the following 3 questions: 1) Motive: Who had a reason to kill the victim? 2) Means: Who had access to the murder weapon and victim? 3) Opportunity: Who had a chance to kill the victim? Is any particular person unaccounted for during the time the victim was killed?

If you get stuck anytime during your investigation, you can access misplaced case files online for hints to keep you moving. Once you think you know the solution, access complete solutions online to confirm your suspicions and make an arrest.

Enclosed you will find the following:

- Case Evidence (32)
- Crime Scene Photos (5)
- Suspect Photos (9)
- Newspaper and Magazine Articles (3)
- Instructions and Suspect Sheet (2)
- File Folder (1)
- Links to Online Hints and Solution

During a stay on the Lady Marigold II, a luxury yacht (and home to the most sought-after casino in open waters), you and your fellow guests are ready for a relaxing vacation. One night, a storm rolls in and you spot the captain face down in the water! As the storm worsens and the boat takes on water, you must escape the yacht and solve the mystery of who pushed the captain overboard, where they did it, and why.

The Clue Sabotage on the High Seas Escape & Solve Mystery board game combines the intrigue and characters of the classic murder mystery game Clue with a riveting escape room experience. Players move their pawns around the gameboard that's built room-by-room, as they explore the yacht, draw cards, solve puzzles, unlock new rooms on the ship, and use deduction to uncover clues. After escaping the yacht, players review the clues to make a correct accusation and win the game!

Includes 6 plastic pawns, 7 gameboards, 1 secret envelope, 1 unknown object, 131 cards, and game guide.

Difficulty: 2/5

--description from publisher's website

Herding Cats Dice Game is a game of rolling dice to gather tokens from the banker, with a push your luck element similar to Farkle. These tokens may be exchanged for cats when certain colour combinations are met

A Steal dice result allows you to steal a cat from another player, both advancing your position and reducing the number of cats they have. The winner is the first player to accumulate 65 cats.

In a valley, the flowers bloom every year in spring. Many children often collect flowers and arrange them in a vase for a grandmother because she loves flowers and she is unable to climb the mountain to appreciate these flowers by herself.

Players will play as the children who collect flowers on the mountain and arrange them in a vase for this grandmother. If any person can arrange the most beautiful flower vase for a grandmother, that player will win the game.

Bees are the main theme of this game. You can find honey combs with values from one to ten, but also the queen bee, worth zero. Zero for a queen bee sounds nothing, but that's what the game is about: Gathering as little points as possible, as the games name suggests. Besides the honey combs there are a few action cards, worth twenty points.

At the begin of the game, each player is dealt hidden cards, he may peek at two of them. Game proceeds in clockwise order, players draw a card. Action cards are executed immediately, honey combs and queen bees may replace any of the hidden cards or be discarded. If a player thinks, that he has the least score in his hidden cards, he can announce the end of the round. Everybody else has one more turn, then the cards are revealed. Each player gets points according to his cards. If the announcer does not have the least score, he is fined additional points.

The game leaves out any kind of plastic packaging, a percentage of the revenue is donated to projects protecting bees.

A game for 2-4 players where sharks are struggling for survival, trying to eat a varied diet of sea creatures while avoiding ocean pollution and outmaneuvering a boat and rival sharks.

Points are scored based on the fish consumed and the game ends when a shark's tummy is full.

The game is playable by ages 8-and-up, playable in adult gaming groups, mixed adult-child groups, or by children independently.

Catch is the game about the art of catching and keeping your dream partner. The winner of the game is the one who collected the most points by answering the questions correctly, correctly guessing how the fellow players answered, writing funny pickup lines and being good at body language.

Except in the Heart category, the game is played in the form of duels between two players. The duelist of the player is chosen by each fellow player rolling their dice in turn. Whoever gets the same symbol as the player becomes a duellist. After each duel, it is the next player's turn to roll the dice and get a duelist. The side shown on the dice is the category to compete in. The categories are Heart (fun fact questions), Magnifying glass (Intimate and close, players have to guess what the other answers to intimate questions), House (Living together, questions about relationships and cohabitation), the Speech bubble (funniest pickup line), Thumbs up (best body language) and Frog (the player gets to choose category and duelist).

Players collect points and the one with the most when the time is up (30 minutes recommended) can title themselves the ultimate dream partner!
Question and dice game based on a popular travel program on Swedish television. Contains 25 game variants.
Air shooter is an action game where you use an air gun to shoot tiles to hit targets with different scores. Whoever gets the most points wins.

A fast paced adventure for the whole family. Somewhere on the island is a treasure. Find it and hurry back to the ship. Look out for sculls, sea creatures, cannons and the other cattrickies! Roll the dice, decide your next step, move your cattricky and look out for threats.

Compete against each other alone or in teams, in seven different disciplines that require precision, skill and a bit of luck. Load the ring slinger, aim carefully and launch the rings.

The game is divided into seven separate branches consisting of different courses that are built on the table. With the help of your ring lunge, you must either hit the mark, be the fastest through a course or what is meant in the next branch. Each player gets points based on their position and whoever collects the most after seven branches wins.

—user summary

Myror i brallans naturspel is based on a popular nature program for children that was broadcast on Swedish television. One of the most popular features was guessing which animal a specific poo was from and which you can also do in the game.

You roll dice, walk around the board and try to find all the tiles that belong to your animal as quickly as possible. The first person to reach the center with all the pieces wins.

—user summary

The player on turn is the seeker who draws a card and reads the answers. All players, including the seeker, use their answer tiles to choose the option they like best. All players who have the same choice as the seeker may move forward on the board. Both the seeker and the other players (soulmates) move towards the center on two separate tracks.

When a player reaches the middle, that player must find their soul mate by performing the final match. This is done by asking three questions in turn with a new question, all of which must match the player's answer. If not, it moves on to the next player and so on until a player has answered correctly three times in a row. The two players are then chosen as winners.

What’s something you can’t do in public? Or something you can lick? A word that starts with a P that a 7-year-old can’t understand? Or a superhero that starts with L?

A game that tests your speed and creativity, Letterpool won’t leave you and your friends yawning. Show off your wit by being the first one to come up with words and grab letters worth points.

REMEMBER: Brevity is the soul of wit!

WITH 2 MODES TO PLAY: PARTY -OR- TRIVIA - for double the fun

—description from the publisher

Test your proficiency in all matters D&D with TRIVIAL PURSUIT: Dungeons & Dragons Ultimate Edition! Show your mettle as an all-knowing adventurer in this comprehensive challenge based on the classic role-playing game. Navigate the custom game board with iconic D&D character movers in this full-sized collectible edition featuring 1800 questions on Dungeons & Adventures, Monsters, History, Cosmology, Characters, and Magic & Miscellany.

—description from the publisher

The sky is full of wonders. We are starting to understand them but not always it has been like that. The devoted people of Carcassonne, lead by superstition, would read the signs in the skies as omens, premonitions, divine messages, or even punishments from the heavens... Repent or you will all be damned.

The effect of the tiles in this mini expansion can be summarized as follows:

     A solar eclipse will fill the hearts of the followers in the area with terror. They will flee to the nearest religious place to pray for salvation: monasteries, cathedrals in cities, German cathedrals,...
     A moon eclipse will disband any thieves on a road, as they will fear for their lives.
     A comet will serve as a heavenly sign for the next player founding a new city, who will persevere in this endeavour moved by their faith. The player will be granted with up to three turns while extending this new city.
     A meteor shower will be a sign of luck for players. Fate will grant them the favour to choose between two tiles in their next three turns.

Everyone loves a good selfie and birds are no exception ! These birds happily hop from wire to wire before immortalizing their poses in crazy and clever snapshots.

Classic game rules :
- Object of the Game : Win the most points by recreating the bird’s poses from the Selfie cards on the wire.

- Playing the game: 
The player who can do the best bird call plays first and play then continues clockwise.
Sort the Selfie cards by the level indicated on the back of the card (2/3/4/5 birds) and put them into 4 separate, easy to reach piles.
Deal one Level 2 card, one Level 3 card and 3 eggs to each player. Put the remaining eggs in a reserve next to the Selfie cards.
The game has 2 main phases :
• PERCH AND POSE
THEN
• FLYING THE NEST.

- End of the game :
The game ends when there are no birds left on the wires.
Count the number of points shown on your completed Selfie cards, and score 1 point per unspent egg.
The player(s) with the most points win.

Cooperative rules:
Playing in cooperative mode allows you to challenge yourselves further. Most of the rules are the same, but there are a few differences.

- Object of the game : 
Win the most points by recreating the bird’s poses from the Selfie cards on the wire.

- Playing the game :  
The game has 2 main phases :
• PERCH AND POSE
THEN
• FLYING THE NEST.

- End of the game : 
• All cards have been completed without needing to play the Flying The Nest phase:Truly Eggscellent work!
• All cards have been completed after the Flying The Nest phase : Well done! Add a feather to your cap !
• You haven’t completed all the cards: Better luck next time, Featherbrains!

-description from publisher

The King has issued a Royal decree:

BUILD!

Tiny Kingdom Builder is a small worker placement game for 2-4 players.

Who will build their project first?

Utilize your workers to gather the material you need to finish your Building first. The first player to collect all their material wins! But be careful, with prosperity comes wandering eyes. Make sure the Thief doesn't steal from you!

The hunting season commences at the Valley. Tribes hailing from the four equators of the world join forces every year to battle the wild animals and the valley dwellers. The tribes must return home with sufficient prey before the winter sets, or they will not survive the cold season. Their centuries-old alliance is fragile. One chief secretly plans to break the pact to attain sole power. Another cares only about self-interest, even to the detriment of others. Who’s a friend, and who’s an enemy? Decide, and lead your tribe to victory!

The teams and the goals of the players are allotted randomly at the start. These remain secret until the end of the game. The players’ task is to find out the motivations and teams of others while aiming to complete their own goals. Players may openly support or block others, while they also possess action cards that secretly influence the outcome of actions.

The game consists of turns. The players gather berries at first, then carry out steps consecutively in the order defined by their roles, and finally, they defend together. At the beginning of a new turn, the roles alternate. Therefore the players’ order and abilities change. When the players are out of their shared vigor, the game ends. Players who have completed their victory goals win the game. Multiple teams may win, or there can be no winner.

Many of the illustrations of the game depict nudity, therefore the game is for 18+ only.

—description from the designer

You all are cats from cat star who tries to be born again as a cat with the most potential, by trying to lead a cat to a specific place. Beware! Some of them aren't cat at all!
A rondel-style game in which you will play one of pawed card from your hand to create a pattern for the cat to walk around in a circle tries to find the best cat (or not-a-cat) that suit you and give the most points. The one who has the most fish (or in other words, points) is the winner of the game.

Sail to glory on the High Seas, physically firing your cannons at your opponents' ships to score victory points! Pick up treasure maps and take them to islands to reveal the hidden treasure chests. Use the gun tower and the monstrous Kraken to your advantage while trying not to get hit yourself!

"Fancy a game of chance with death!?

Aye, you be skilled enough to navigate the treacherous waters, looking for the clues to find treasure. A sandbar or a storm won't get you dead, but the cannons will!

But let's assume for a moment that yer ship and yer crew don't fall to the dangers that every pirate faces: the sea, the blasts, and the thirst for gold. There ain't no friends on the sea.

And then, there's the Kraken! Is your ship fast enough to outrun it? No, listen to me. You better stay far, lest it claims yer ship and crew!"

- Captain Sam “Hard Port” Stevenson of the Sapphire

To Glory! is a 2-4 player dexterity, action point game. Each player assumes the role of a captain on a pirate ship searching for treasures in the High Seas.

During your turn, you execute a combination of actions - move, steer, explore, cannon volley - trying to score victory points by firing cubes at your opponents. The number of victory points is based on the result of your volleys: direct hit, landing on the target ship, or knocking their captain overboard.

The main objective of the game is to explore the islands and follow the marks on the treasure maps to recover hidden treasures. The game ends when a captain acquires two treasures. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

-description from publisher

Help the little wizards save the school from Goblin slime! The sneaky goblins have been leaving their slime all over the school, making a big mess. Race through the magical lands around the school to be the first little wizard to reach the goblin caves and convince them to clean up their mess to become the hero of the magic school!

In My First Magic School, kids will race through around the lands surrounding the magic school, using numbered cards to move ahead, while trying to be the first one to reach the goblin caves. But they better be careful! Along the path there are slime-covered spots that could send them back, as well as spells and potions to collect. Players move by using their numbered cards to get ahead. Use your cards strategically to avoid landing in slime, pick up spells and potions, and slow other wizards down. Once a player reaches the goblin caves, they roll the dice to see how the goblins will respond. The first player to reach the goblins and convince them to clean up is the winner!

The bright magical board, characters, and cards make this story driven game a great way to help kids develop their strategic thinking and counting skills. Limited reading and simple counting make this an easy game for kids 5 and up to learn and enjoy!

-description from publisher

“It’s the lunchtime rush at your cafe and you have a queue of hungry customers!Can you serve enough sandwiches in time to keep them all satisfied?”

Stack ingredient cards, make sandwiches, and serve your customers to complete their orders and refresh your actions. If you run out of actions your customers will leave and give you a bad review!

Crumbs! The Sandwich Filler Game is a cute and compact (but challenging) solo/co-op microgame for 1-2 players. With a variable setup, quick playtime (10-20 mins), and satisfying gameplay, Crumbs! is a game that'll leave you hungry for more!

With only five actions each round to serve a sandwich, use them efficiently to make multiple sandwiches at once and keep your counter well-stocked. Each sandwich served resets your actions, but run out and your customers will leave and give you a bad review! Complete orders to reveal your next customers, and clear your queue to win the game.

'Crumbs!' also includes optional additional rules for 'Quirky Customers' to add another challenge to the game.

-description from publisher

In 1872, the Government of Meiji Japan promoted immigration to Sapporo to develop Hokkaido.

In 1876, Sapporo Agricultural College was opened to develop human resources, including immigrants.

Players are feudal lords who have moved to Sapporo. Contribute to Sapporo's municipal government in order to raise your clan's prosperity and wealth.

To achieve this, it is important to contribute to the education at the Agricultural College. Send your well-trained pupils to the city hall and put them into vital positions. It is also important to cultivate lands, build personal contacts, and invest in buildings for future prosperity.

At the end of the game, the player who has earned more fame points will have their name engraved in the history of Sapporo development.

Candy Factory (3/5 difficulty)

Your sweet-as-candy Uncle Lucas Ollie has got himself caught in chewing gum while making the biggest batch of candy ever. He needs your help in the Candy Factory now to get everything sorted before Halloween. If only you had paid closer attention during all those -boring- factory tours... But then you accidentally stumble across Uncle Lucas's massive secret!

Super Heroes Next Generation (3.5/5 difficulty)

In one hit, an ageing ray has turned Super Team X into powerless old folk! Who's behind this? Is it professor Sprout, Sir Charles Gourmand, or rebel Ann Archy after all? It is up to you, the new generation of superheroes, to work this out and to rescue your parents from the care home. Quickly, before it's too late!

It's always a race against the clock; you only have 60 minutes to escape.

Contents: Electronic Chrono Decoder, Hint Decoder, 16 Keys, 3x8 Hint Cards,

--description from publisher's website

Stand-alone expansion with new songs in Spanish for El MelÃ³mano.

Contains 128 cards to sing and answer, with greatest hits.

It can be played with the original game, or individually.

Pilgrim is a fast-paced, fighting, strategic card game for 2 to 4 players. Each player acts as a leader of his army, whose composition from round to round changes by representatives of four different races - Elves, Dwarves, Orcs, and Undead, as well as rare representatives of the Pilgrims.

Players fight each other in a big battle for gold, consisting of three chains of rounds. In the 1st chain, the number of bouts increases by one each round and decreases by one in the 3rd. In the middle 2nd chain, the number of bouts is always 8.

During all chains, the game goes the same way - players try to win as many coins as possible, which can be obtained by beating off cards according to certain rules. At the end of the game, players count all earned coins, and the player with the highest amount of them wins.

—description from the designer

Venn is a bluffing card game.

With only three different types of cards, this colour based card deck has two completely different card games that are quick to learn.

'Venn Classic' is game one and 'Venn Party' is game two.

In both games, there is no such thing as a bad hand or a weak card, winning and losing are down to how you play. You’ll need to bluff in order to prevent your opponents from winning easily, but bluff too much and you’ll be easily found out.

The object of Venn Classic (game one) is to find cards of a certain colour while stopping your opponents from doing the same. The game is played in rounds and at the end of each round, cards are lost. The last player to have cards in their hand is the winner.

The object of Venn Party (game two) is to push a card to a player while stating a colour and get the receiving player to incorrectly guess if they are telling the truth or not. The game is played in rounds and at the end of each round, one card is discarded. The game ends when all cards have been used and the winner is the player with the fewest cards in front of them.

—description from the designer

Test your architectural skills in Blueprints of Mad King Ludwig, a flip-and-sketch strategy game to draw the most extravagant blueprints for King Ludwig's next castle!

Select rooms to add to your castle's floor plan. As you complete rooms' entrances by connecting them to other rooms, earn new abilities such as adding or removing entrances, earning new bonus cards, and taking extra turns. Keep your eye on the King's favors to beat out your opponents for public goals, as well as create courtyards and moats around your castle for some massive points to get ahead! The player who sketches the castle most suited to the whims of King Ludwig takes the royal victory!

—description from the publisher

An expansive 4X empire building strategy game where you and up to 5 other players vie to be the most dominant empire in the land. Achieve victory by being the first empire to reach 10 Victory points through any combination of Economic, military, societal and technological means. Explore a new land with over 75 unique border tiles allowing billions of possible board combinations across 3 different board sizes.

With over 500 models, every building and unit in Impyrium has a physical model that can be placed on the board or within the larger city and settlement models. Spread your workers across the land to harvest resources from the land. Then grow your economy by constructing farms, mills, mines and quarries. Build barracks and stables to train infantry and cavalry units. Build markets to foster commerce and trade resources with allied and rival empires. Or become a beacon of science and education by constructing universities to research over 100 unique technology cards.

Choose wisely from one of the 5 government systems, each providing you empire and leader specific bonuses based on their area of focus. Autocrats rule with an iron fist able to construct cities and monuments with easy. Monarchs are able to requisition additional armies with gold from their treasury as well as being powerful generals. Those who choose to implement a democratic government foster a culture of innovation allowing their empire to quickly advance through the ages and develop new technologies.

Track all your Empire's advancements and achievements on your play board. There you can purchase upgrades for your buildings and units, store your unspent resources and most importantly track your victory points.

—description from the designer

Make math fun for the whole family with Target: a fast-paced, teacher-recommended mental math game that is great for kids ages 8 and up, teachers, tutors, and even adults! Perfect for remote learning, homeschool math, family game nights, and more!

How to Play:
Each round a black card is flipped over with a number on it. Players use their white cards to make an equation to equal the number on the black card. Players shout "Target!" and explain their equation! If correct, they collect the black card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins!

Drylands are fragile ecosystems where deserts border savanna and/or forest biomes. These places can easily be degraded into desert like conditions or nurtured to be greener and more productive. It depends on how the land is managed.

In this two player game the desert player competes with the forest player to decide the outcome of a small section of drylands.

Each turn players can “grow” by placing a new tile next to their established tiles, or they can “leap” using an existing tile to move to a location farther away. Whenever you place one of your tiles next to opponent tiles, either through growing or leaping, those opponent tiles flip and become yours.

The game ends when all spaces on the board are occupied. The player with the most tiles of their type wins!

A game that’s easy to learn but hard to master, it is suitable for a wide range of ages, from 5 to 105.

Gain as many dice, rerolls, and multipliers as possible for the final big roll! High Score Wins! Axolotl Dice? More like that’s a lotta dice!

The game is played over 12 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most dice, rerolls, and multipliers by advancing on the 18 number tracks. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, using the dice however each player determines. At the end of the game, each player will make a final Big Roll depending on how many dice they gained. The player with the highest score wins!

-description from designer

“Welcome to Rune-Midgarts, adventurers. To prepare all of you for the thrilling adventures that await, your first mission is to capture the monsters that are running amok within the neighborhood. The stronger the monsters you can capture, the greater your rewards… As this is a competition, I have no intention to prevent you from hindering each other.”
You, newcomers known as “Novices” in this world, are about to compete with each other for the monster-capturing mission. The first person who returns with the biggest band of captives shall become the champion!

—description from the publisher

Round cards on a stack... turn around one... and then quickly shout which animal is shown exactly three times on that card to collect it. Action cards add to the fun so you not only need to closely (and quickly) identify the visuals but also to (very quickly) react to new challenges.

A game to train your Eye-Brain-Mouth-coordination skills, also very quickly played.

You are a Dimensional traveler. 
Your objective is to collect the “ELEMENT” to summon the souls from the sacred shrine. What you need to gather is the spirit energy from each shrine emits. The amount of emitted energy depends on the amount of EACH ELEMENT in the summoning ritual.
LET’s FIND THE BEST DIMENSION TRAVELER IN .. “ THE ELEMENT ”

The game will play turn by turn.
The player have to choose to collect element or spirit ritual

You have to spend at least 3 types of ELEMENT and the total value of ELEMENT must equal to the Shrine cost.
gains scores according to the most spent ELEMENT.

—description from the designer

Sid Sackson's classics Samarkand & Bazaar are now combined as two games in one box with this new edition of both games.

Samarkand is a fast-paced trading and selling game set in exotic Asia Minor. Cunning Merchants buy, exchange, and sell goods to build wealth. When visiting Nomad Camps and after offering gifts for their hosts’ hospitality, Merchants trade for the goods they desire. When visiting Oases, they may purchase random goods. Ultimately, these Merchants travel to the bazaars in Cities such as Samarkand or Isfahan to sell the goods they have acquired. Merchants must plan which desert paths to use to travel efficiently between the Nomad Camps, Oases, and Cities so they can earn the quickest (and greatest) profit!

In Bazaar, players attempt to gain the right combination of colored cubes through skillful trading to purchase the wares displayed in the Bazaar. Values of the various wares are determined by the number of cubes the purchaser has left over following the transaction. Trading is governed by the current rates posted at the Exchange. When the wares from two stalls have been completely sold, the Bazaar is closed, and the game ends. The player with the highest score wins!

-description from publisher
